b8f732bb-ddae-45d4-93ea-33f9594354f5.description: The earner of this badge has the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to effectively coach and mentor people while adhering to a professional code of ethics. The APUS Certified Professional Coach (CPC) program consists of three courses: Coaching and Mentoring I: Foundations of Coaching, Coaching and Mentoring II: Emotional Intelligence (EI) & Assessments, and Coaching and Mentoring III: Coaching Groups & Teams.
b8f732bb-ddae-45d4-93ea-33f9594354f5.name: Certified Professional Coach Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a total of 78-hours of instruction including: 30-hours of synchronous, instructor-led webinars; 30-hours of facilitated coaching practice; 15-hours of self-directed training (i.e., videos, audios, reading, and quizzes); and 3-hours of coach-and-be-coached with a certified professional coach.

96bdf0b3-76c5-4ea6-a9b9-efca50a35036.description: Holder has completed the Bachelor of Science in Cybersecurity at American Military University or American Public University, part of the American Public University System. The National Security Agency has validated this program of study and recognizes the APUS Center for Cyber Defense as National Center of Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity – Cyber Defense.
96bdf0b3-76c5-4ea6-a9b9-efca50a35036.name: National Center of Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity – Cyber Defense

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of B.S. in Cybersecurity which includes specific Knowledge Units defined by NCAE-C

87435784-40e6-4ba8-b642-3c1b820b7fd9.description: The earner of this badge has the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to effectively coach and mentor people while adhering to a professional code of ethics. The AMU Certified Professional Coach (CPC) program consists of three courses: Foundations of Coaching, Emotional Intelligence (EI) &Coaching Assessments, and Coaching Groups & Teams.
87435784-40e6-4ba8-b642-3c1b820b7fd9.name: AMU Certified Professional Coach Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a total of 375-hours of instruction including: 30-hours of facilitated coaching practice; 200-hours of self-directed learning (i.e., videos, audios, reading, and quizzes);175-hours of blended learning (i.e. discussions, assignments, projects, etc.) and 3-hours of coach-and-be-coached with a certified professional coach.

75c10478-615b-4a4f-974e-6a3625aa4252.description: The earner of this badge has the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to effectively coach and mentor people while adhering to a professional code of ethics. The APU Certified Professional Coach (CPC) program consists of three courses: Foundations of Coaching, Emotional Intelligence (EI) &Coaching Assessments, and Coaching Groups & Teams.
75c10478-615b-4a4f-974e-6a3625aa4252.name: APU Certified Professional Coach Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a total of 375-hours of instruction including: 30-hours of facilitated coaching practice; 200-hours of self-directed learning (i.e., videos, audios, reading, and quizzes);175-hours of blended learning (i.e. discussions, assignments, projects, etc.) and 3-hours of coach-and-be-coached with a certified professional coach.

cea45267-892c-4f26-97f5-56cfc381e3e2.description: This American Military University (AMU) graduate NanoCert in Advanced Cybersecurity/Cybercrime is a three-course program including the study of advanced cybercrime analysis, intrusion detection and incident handling, and advanced digital forensics.
cea45267-892c-4f26-97f5-56cfc381e3e2.name: Graduate NanoCert® Advanced Cybersecurity/Cybercrime

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: ISSC630 Advanced Cybercrime Analysis, ISSC642 Intrusion Detection and Incident Handling, and ISSC650 Advanced Digital Forensics.

5333a4e9-f3d2-4f85-92a3-b8c3a42189af.description: This American Military University (AMU) graduate NanoCert in Counterintelligence is a three-course program including the study of counterintelligence; deception, propaganda, and disinformation; and human intelligence. It is designed for students who wish to heighten their knowledge of counterintelligence.
5333a4e9-f3d2-4f85-92a3-b8c3a42189af.name: Graduate NanoCert® Counterintelligence

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: INTL610 Counterintelligence, INTL623 Human Intelligence (HUMINT), INTL653 Deception, Propaganda and Disinformation.

633b554c-dfb1-43ad-9113-228b4a82dbb6.description: This American Military University (AMU) graduate NanoCert in Criminal Intelligence is a three-course program designed for learners focused on criminal intelligence analysis, transnational crime and narcotics, and organized crime. It is designed for students who wish to enhance their criminal intelligence knowledge.
633b554c-dfb1-43ad-9113-228b4a82dbb6.name: Graduate NanoCert® Criminal Intelligence

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: INTL631 Criminal Intelligence Analysis, INTL646 Transnational Crime and Narcotics, and CMRJ524 Organized Crime.

7e22f042-6851-4c07-a29c-b9f4d420bc4e.description: This American Public University (APU) graduate NanoCert in Intelligence Analysis is a three-course program involving the study of the tradecraft, techniques, and challenges of intelligence analysis. 7e22f042-6851-4c07-a29c-b9f4d420bc4e.name: Graduate NanoCert® Intelligence Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: INTL508 Intelligence Analysis, INTL635 Indications and Warnings, and INTL637 Intelligence Profiling.

f25fab6c-48af-464e-b91a-d4020dcfd244.description: This American Military University (AMU) graduate NanoCert in Organizational Effectiveness explores organizational management, organizational development and organizational crisis management. Topics examined also include leadership management, management effectiveness, and how to apply "best practices".
f25fab6c-48af-464e-b91a-d4020dcfd244.name: Graduate NanoCert® Organizational Effectiveness

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: MGMT604 Organizational Crisis Management, MGMT600 Organizational Management, and MGMT603 Organizational Development.

6ff860b5-bda0-4308-ba4b-4bb732d967f3.description: This American Military University (AMU) graduate NanoCert in Teaching Adult Learners Online is intended for professionals who want to teach postsecondary and other adult learners in a variety of settings such as corporations, government organizations, healthcare agencies, community colleges, and other education contexts.

1799d23f-aea0-43e3-b0d0-ef2461768ceb.description: This American Military University (AMU) undergraduate NanoCert in Criminal Intelligence is a three-course program involving the study of criminal intelligence analysis, crime analysis, and law enforcement intelligence applications. 7c5a1e90-dc71-469d-b264-7b1d25428c6c.description: This American Military University (AMU) undergraduate NanoCert in Intelligence Analysis is a three-course program involving the study of how critical thinking relates to intelligence analysis, structural analysis, and threat analysis. ee5c5bdb-ec99-4ea1-a990-136a72bf8cbb.description: This American Military University (AMU) graduate NanoCert in Entrepreneurship is a concentrated program for students seeking to start their own venture. This program provides an introduction to entrepreneurial strategy for anyone thinking about opening a business.

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: EDUC621 Online Learning for the Adult and the K-16 Learner, EDUC622 Ethics and Legal Issues in Online Learning, and EDUC625 Instructional Design in Online Learning.

87590b2d-38b2-4e99-a1e7-1b038984a42e.description: This American Military University (AMU) graduate NanoCert in Terrorism is a three-course program involving the study of counterterrorism, assessing the past to forecast the future of terrorism, and domestic terrorism and extremist groups.
87590b2d-38b2-4e99-a1e7-1b038984a42e.name: Graduate NanoCert® Terrorism

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: INTL650 Counterrorism, INTL652 Terrorism: Assessing the Past to Forecast the Future, and HLSS523 Domestic Terrorism and Extremist Groups.

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: INTL650 Counterrorism, INTL652 Terrorism: Assessing the Past to Forecast the Future, and HLSS523 Domestic Terrorism and Extremist Groups.

5dcd0a76-7626-4adb-81c9-a480d7dedf7a.description: This American Military University (AMU) undergraduate NanoCert in Business Analytics is a concentrated program designed for managers who wish to solve business problems in today’s competitive business environment using analytics for decision-making. badge_template_activities.title: To earn this NanoCert, the learner must complete nine semester hours of courses: BUSN250 Analytics I; BUSN350 Analytics II; BUSN450 Advanced Analytics.

158bdb7e-8d0f-469a-bfc4-afe3b5b25333.description: This American Public University (APU) undergraduate NanoCert in Counterintelligence requires the learner to study and analyze counterintelligence operations focusing on activities that comprise counterintelligence functional activities, including the detection of espionage and elicitation; counterintelligence interviews/debriefings; and the collection of counterintelligence information.

4166efcc-3644-43d0-9da5-c8df3802f2ae.description: This American Public University (APU) undergraduate NanoCert in Introduction to IT Project Management program will introduce you to basic program management skills; provide you introductory understanding of program management strategies and tools; and explore concepts, principles, theories, guidelines, and techniques associated with applying project management to the contracting profession or non-contracting acquisition process.

635a2230-fc98-4711-a99d-455393dcc887.description: This American Public University (APU) undergraduate NanoCert offers a foundation in risk analysis and crisis management. The program focuses on difficult issues crisis managers face to protect the organization, its stakeholders, and assets from man-made and natural disasters. Typical issues focus on how to analyze risk and potential crises that affect the success of the organization.
